definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
gall bladder/courage/guts/gall/inner container (e.g. bladder of a football, inner container of a thermos)

sentences.english: Bartender and a few bold people who followed him out.
sentences.chinese: 酒保和几个大胆的人跟在他身后走了出去。

sentences.english: The British approach is equally bold.
sentences.chinese: 英国的举措也是同样大胆。

sentences.english: Such chutzpah seems to be the key to Mr. Liao’s success.
sentences.chinese: 这种大胆妄为正是廖先生成功的关键。

sentences.english: BOLD】Climbing the steep mountain is a bold act.
sentences.chinese: 爬那座险峻的山是大胆的行为。

sentences.english: The bold folk fold up the gold or hold it in hor.
sentences.chinese: 大胆的大部份人将金子折叠起来拿在手里。

sentences.english: He sprayed all sorts of colors daringly, and they looked really fantastic on paper.
sentences.chinese: 他大胆地喷涂各种颜色，纸上呈现出的效果好看。

sentences.english: Courageous, bold, almost to the point of ferocity, they were untiring and resistant to pain.
sentences.chinese: 勇敢，大胆，几乎到了凶猛点，他们不知疲倦和耐痛。

sentences.english: It's a daring way to jump-start one's own literary celebrity.
sentences.chinese: 发起自己在文学上的声望是一种很大胆的方式。

sentences.english: Made a searching and fearless inventory of our virtues and strengths.
sentences.chinese: 大胆的探索自己拥有的美德和优势。

sentences.english: The special-operations officer spoke more boldly.
sentences.chinese: 特战官员的言论则更为大胆。

sentences.english: Metzen: That sounds like a dare right there.
sentences.chinese: 听起来是个大胆的主意。

sentences.english: Does she can tell her family she is your female confidant?
sentences.chinese: 她可以大胆地告诉她的家人，她是你的红颜知已吗？

sentences.english: Dauntless the slug-horn to my lips I set.
sentences.chinese: 我大胆地将金属号角在我的唇边放好。

sentences.english: Taking advantage of abstract line, brilliant color and high-sounding intersperse reveals luxurious feature.
sentences.chinese: 抽象的线条，大胆的颜色和夸张的点缀尽显致奢华。

sentences.english: Today we salute women whose triumphs are written in bold on the pages of history.
sentences.chinese: 今天我们向胜利被写在大胆在历史页的妇女致敬。

sentences.english: Anyway, we should seriously study the tradition and hardily develop the future.
sentences.chinese: 我们要扎实的学习传统又要大胆地开拓未来。

definition: to have the courage to do sth/to dare to/bold in
expert/scholar/mother earth/a type of green tea
to make a show of being original or unconventional (idiom)
lit. new bud/fig. new and original
